title: Photography Service Website (About, Portfolio, Pricing, Packages)

requirements.text: Create a responsive marketing website for a photography service with a top navigation and sections/pages for: Home (hero + overview), About Us, Our Work (portfolio gallery), Pricing, and Package Details.

quotes: Create a website for photography service inlude pricing & about us & our work & package details

acceptanceCriteria: Site has clear navigation links to Home, About Us, Our Work, Pricing, and Packages/Package Details.
All pages/sections are usable on mobile and desktop (responsive layout).
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Implement the About Us section/page with: a short studio/service story, photographer highlights (e.g., 2â€“4 cards), and a list of service specialties (e.g., weddings, portraits, events, product).
acceptanceCriteria: About Us includes at least one narrative paragraph, a set of highlight cards, and a specialties list.
Layout remains readable and well-spaced on small screens.

requirements.text: Implement the Our Work (Portfolio) section/page as a gallery with category filters (e.g., Weddings, Portraits, Events, Product) and a lightbox/modal preview when an image is clicked.
acceptanceCriteria: Gallery shows a grid of portfolio images with visible category labels or filter controls.
Selecting a filter updates the visible gallery items.
Clicking a gallery item opens a larger preview in a modal/lightbox and can be closed.

requirements.text: Implement the Pricing section/page with a clear pricing table/cards for at least 3 tiers (e.g., Basic, Standard, Premium), including price, short description, and key inclusions.
acceptanceCriteria: Pricing displays at least three tiers with price and bullet-point inclusions.
Pricing layout is readable on mobile and aligns cleanly on desktop.

requirements.text: Implement the Package Details section/page that expands each package into a detailed view including: duration/coverage, deliverables (e.g., edited photos count), turnaround time, add-ons, and booking terms.
acceptanceCriteria: Each package has a detailed breakdown (coverage, deliverables, turnaround, add-ons, terms).
Package details are scannable (headings, lists) and consistent across packages.

requirements.text: Add a Contact/Inquiry call-to-action area (on Home and/or Contact section) with a simple form (name, email, event type, date, message). Submission should show a success message and store the inquiry locally in browser state only (no backend persistence) unless a backend is explicitly requested later.

quotes: Create a website for photography service inlude pricing & about us & our work & package details

acceptanceCriteria: Form includes fields: name, email, event type, date, message.
Basic validation exists (required fields; email format).
On submit, a success confirmation is shown and no network request is required.

requirements.text: Establish a coherent visual theme and design system for the site (colors, typography, spacing, buttons, cards) and apply it consistently across all pages/sections. Use a warm, editorial style (e.g., cream/charcoal accents, elegant serif headings paired with clean sans-serif body) and avoid blue/purple-dominant palettes.

quotes: Create a website for photography service inlude pricing & about us & our work & package details

acceptanceCriteria: A consistent color palette and typography pairing is used across the site.
Primary and secondary button styles are consistent and accessible (contrast).
Cards/sections share consistent spacing and alignment patterns.

requirements.text: Add generated static image assets to support the design (hero image and portfolio placeholders) and render them from frontend/public/assets/generated without routing images through the backend.

quotes: Create a website for photography service inlude pricing & about us & our work & package details

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced by the UI.
Home hero uses the generated hero image.
Portfolio gallery uses the generated portfolio images as placeholders/sample work.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only UI components must be composed, not modified).
Do not edit files in frontend immutablePaths (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor if any backend work is later added.
nonGoals: Online payments, bookings with calendars, or third-party integrations.
Admin dashboard/CMS for managing portfolio items.
User accounts or authentication (Internet Identity) unless explicitly requested.
